title: Ticket #6599: remove the need for most wrapper scripts
description:
It is our belief in most cases, the use of job wrapper scripts by users or administrators is an indication that HTCondor is lacking in necessary features. This ticket is an examination of some specific wrapper scripts in use with the 8.6 stable release with analysis of what features should be added to make these scripts unnecessary

Wrappers come in 2 forms

  1. Administrator defined wrappers (aka USER_JOB_WRAPPER)
  2. User defined wrappers - a submit file where the executable is a script that wraps the real job.

Administrator defined wrappers

On the STARTD, the USER_JOB_WRAPPER configuration knob can be set to provide a wrapper script for all jobs that run on that node. These are undesirable because they don't compose - only one wrapper is allowed for all jobs, so it must handle all forms of wrapping.

In this category we have two examples

  1. singularity-job-wrapper.sh - a wrapper for singularity jobs used by OSG
  2. condor-docker - a wrapper for docker jobs used by Fermi

singularity-job-wrapper

In pseudo-code this wrapper does the following: 

    if the job has a SingularityImage attribute AND the STARTD supports singularity
        add "-bind /cvmfs" to singularity args
        if the slot has GPUs
           add "-bind <nvidia drivers/libs>" to singularity args
        set home and pwd for singularity job to /srv
        exec singularity using SingularityImage and input args
    else
        exec the job

There is also code to modify environment variables and paths in the arguments [[anonymous: to adjust for the existence of the wrapper script itself?]]

recommendation None - this wrapper script does not appear to do anything we cannot do with HTCondor's native Singularity support, but it does enable the use of Singularity jobs on versions of HTCondor that have no native Singularity support.

docker-wrapper

in pseudo-code the docker wrapper does 

   add arg to set the hostname of the container to a well known, unique value
   add args to disable swapping
   add environment variables from FERMIHTC_DOCKER_ENV config variable
   if the docker job is using a trusted docker image
      enable --cap--add items from FERMIHTC_DOCKER_CAPABILITIES config variable
   If pull configured
      pull the docker image
   run the docker job with modifed args

recommendation

  • add support for --cap-add for trusted docker images
  • add support for STARTD_JOB_TRANSFORMS in order to customize the environment.

User defined wrappers

We consider the user to have written a wrapper script when the executable statement in the submit file is a script but what the user thinks of as their job is a different executable or script. For instance, most R jobs in CHTC are an R script, with a bash script wrapper.

In this sort of job, the wrapper script is really a setup script, preparing the environment for the job itself. We have many examples, but they all boil down to one or more of these basic operations

  1. download an executable or runtime
  2. unpack a tarball or zip file from file transfer or from step 1
  3. adjust the environment to be correct relative to the current working directory
  4. validate the results and report a job failure if validation fails
  5. delete extraneous files after the job runs and before output transfer
  6. tar/zip the results

recommendation

  • add tar/zip packing and unpacking to file transfer
  • add file transfer blacklist
  • make sandbox directory path available to $$() expansion OR add a mechanism to modify the final environment in the starter before launching the job.

Feature comparison Docker vs. Singularity

Feature Docker Singularity Notes
Specify image job.DockerImage config SINGULARITY_IMAGE_EXPR. default is job.SingularityImage singularity wrapper assumages images are in cvmfs
Image whitelist no via SINGULARITY_IMAGE_EXPR expression
Wrap a job in a container no via SINGULARITY_JOB config starter can convert any vanilla job to a singularity job
MOUNT_UNDER_SCRATCH yes yes docker allows MOUNT_UNDER_SCRATCH to be an expression against the job
Bindmounts config DOCKER_MOUNT_VOLUMES, DOCKER_VOLUME_DIR_xxx, and optionally DOCKER_VOLUME_DIR_xxx_MOUNT_IF config SINGULARITY_BIND_EXPR is expr returning a stringlist. default is job.SingularityBind singularity wrapper does conditional bindmount of nvidia drivers if assigned Gpus
chirp yes yes
STARTER_JOB_ENVIRONMENT yes yes docker-wrapper sets GLIDEIN_ToDie and GLIDEIN_Site
Capabilities config DOCKER_DROP_ALL_CAPABILITIES n/a DAC_OVERRIDE, SETUID, SETGID, SYS_ADMIN, SYS_CHROOT and SYS_PTRACE needed to run singularity within docker
Gpu support 
  via nvida docker wrapper
via SINGULARITY_BIND_EXPR
Nesting no no singularity can be run inside if high capability docker containers
